commit.message:
Try harder to detect local 'nomodeline'

The goal here is to skip modelines if 'nomodeline' is set for the
current buffer (e.g., the ftplugin disables it), but not if it was set
globally (e.g., the system vimrc sets it).  The existing logic
successfully rejects `:setglobal nomodeline`, but fails to reject
`:set nomodeline`, since that sets both the local and global option.  So
lets also reject any local option that was set in the exact same place
as the global option.

All of this can be avoided if you leave 'modeline' enabled and instead
`:set modelines=0`.  Thus this is my recommended way to disable
modelines.

Don't set 'smarttab'

I don't think this does much now that we set 'softtabstop'.

Drop README reference to alternative plugin

We won. ;)

Support b:sleuth_defaults, for symmetry with other buffer options

Not sure there is a reason to use this rather than just setting the
options directly, but for documentation simplicity, I'd rather the
filetype options and the buffer-local options exactly line up.

Avoid silenced output during autocommand

See https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/86, wherein a user notes
that execute("e filename") captures output from Sleuth.  While I don't
think that execute() is a good fit for the given use case, I do think
we should still avoid abstraction leaks like this whenever we can.

Stop .editorconfig hunting on empty override

If you want to override an editorconfig file but continue to the parent
directory, use a dummy file name.
Avoid extra slash when getcwd() == "/"
Support b:sleuth_globs, for symmetry with other buffer options

sleuth.vim 2.0

* Set endofline, fileformat, fileencoding, bomb from EditorConfig.
* Set filetype from modeline and EditorConfig.
* Set softtabstop to -1, always.
* Drop autocmd neighbor detection in favor of simple extension matching.
* Enable disabling heuristics on a per-filetype basis.
* Bug fixes and assorted tweaks.
Copy buffer opt-out from Projectionist

Avoid double slash edge case at file system root

Only a cosmetic issue, as `readfile('//.editorconfig')` works just fine.
Document use of neighboring files during detection
Don't consider buftype=acwrite buffers to have a real filename
Formally deprecate g:sleuth_automatic
Add bash to file types with heredocs

Provide per-filetype defaults configuration

Punting on documentation for now, as I want to explain why
after/ftplugin files are superior for many use cases, and my attempts to
do that all turn into a sprawl.  Usage summary:

        let g:sleuth_javascript_defaults = 'et sw=2'
        let g:sleuth_typescript_defaults = '=typescript'

References: https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/64

Respect b:sleuth_heuristics

The g:sleuth_{filetype}_heuristics level configuration is probably
easier for most people, but this will let you centralize everything in
after/ftplugin if you're using that anyways.

Example after/ftplugin file, with proper b:undo_ftplugin:

	setlocal sw=2 et ts=8
	let b:sleuth_heuristics = 0
	let b:undo_ftplugin = get(b:, 'undo_ftplugin', 'exe') .
	      \ '|setl sw< et< ts|unlet! b:sleuth_heuristics'

References: https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/64

Always set softtabstop=-1

This was motivated by the issue described in and fixed by
<https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/17787>.  On one hand I hate the
complexity this introduces, but on the other it probably matches what
users expect to happen anyways.

Execute :setlocal in top level context

This lets `:verbose set sw?` point at the relevant autocommand rather
than the line of s:Apply() where the option was literally set.

Allow overriding problematic .editorconfig

Usage:

    let g:sleuth_editorconfig_overrides = {
          \ expand('~/bad/repo/.editorconfig'): '.editorconfig.mine'}

The value can be a relative or absolute path, or an empty string to
disable the file without replacing it.  On Windows, forward slashes must
be used.

This is a solution to the problem of a repository including a poorly
considered .editorconfig that can't easily be changed.  Leaving
undocumented because I don't know if this is actually a problem in
practice.

References: https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/79

Set 'filetype' from interactive :Sleuth invocations

I thought the displayed output for this would be complicated to
implement since it needs to happen well after the option is set, but
turns out our idempotent handling of unsafe options works for 'filetype'
too.  I was also worried about recursive invocation, but guarding
against that in a <sfile> check seems adequate.

Restore "%" for current buffer in :verbose Sleuth

I deliberately removed this when changing how modelines are displayed,
while completely forgetting that modelines aren't the only way the
current file could be the source.

Default 'expandtab' when applying, not detecting

This is a stepping stone to having configurable defaults, as it's much
easier to mix in the defaults at application time than at every exit
point of the detection function.

Shorten "neighbor_globs" to "globs"

Noticed when writing documentation for this that such a long option
name didn't fit in columns 48 through 80 like the rest of the options.
The shortened version is still unambiguous, so let's use that.

Not sure when I'll finish writing the documentation.
Disable in 'binary' buffers
Avoid inferring 'ts' when modeline sets 'sw' but not 'et'

Allow disabling heuristics on a per-filetype basis

References: https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/29
Clarify that EditorConfig is project specific
Fix legacy support for Vim without shiftwidth=0

Remove bogus argument

Resolves: https://github.com/tpope/vim-sleuth/issues/81
